page.title: 13Religion, Events, Customs
page.content: Once a month a service is held in the old Fellside school at which all members of other denominations are welcomed. Residents attend regular Church of England and Methodist services in Caldbeck. The main annual event is the Harvest Festival, held in the old school on the last Sunday in October. The service is followed by tea and is always well attended. On the following Monday there is a Harvest (Kurn) supper and social evening. Fellside school is also the venue for evening classes and fund-raising events. Caldbeck Mothers' Union meets there once a year. Foxhunting is a very old local custom, necessary to control the number of foxes which threaten farm stock and poultry. The pack and followers hunt on foot.
